intro: Adonis annua var. cupaniana, commonly known as the cupuanian scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers with four petals, often appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
